migration.title: Migrating from Heap to OpenPanel
migration.intro: Switching from Heap requires rethinking your tracking strategy since OpenPanel doesn't autocapture.

steps.title: Audit your Heap events
steps.description: Review which events you actually use in Heap dashboards and funnels. Identify the essential events since OpenPanel won't autocapture everything.

steps.title: Install OpenPanel SDK
steps.description: Replace Heap's snippet with OpenPanel's lightweight SDK. The SDK is smaller and won't autocapture.

steps.title: Implement event tracking
steps.description: Unlike Heap's autocapture, OpenPanel requires explicit event tracking. Instrument the key events you identified using op.track() calls.

steps.title: Set up user identification
steps.description: Replace heap.identify() with OpenPanel's identify() method. Both platforms support similar user identification patterns.

steps.title: Recreate funnels and reports
steps.description: Build your conversion funnels, retention charts, and dashboards in OpenPanel.

sdk_compatibility.notes: Different tracking philosophies: Heap autocaptures everything, OpenPanel requires explicit tracking. Plan to instrument your key events.

faqs.title: Frequently asked questions
faqs.intro: Common questions about switching from Heap to OpenPanel.

items.question: What is Heap's autocapture and why might I not want it?
items.answer: Heap's autocapture automatically records every user interaction without manual tracking code. While convenient, it can lead to data bloat, higher costs, privacy concerns (capturing sensitive data accidentally), and difficulty managing what's tracked. OpenPanel's explicit tracking gives you full control over data collection.

items.question: Can I self-host Heap?
items.answer: No. Heap is cloud-only with no self-hosting option. Your data always resides on Heap/Contentsquare's infrastructure. OpenPanel offers full self-hosting with Docker for complete data ownership.

items.question: Is Heap open source?
items.answer: No. Heap is entirely proprietary with closed-source code. OpenPanel is fully open source under the MIT license.

items.question: Why is Heap's pricing not public?
items.answer: Heap only shows its Free tier publicly. Growth, Pro, and Premier plans require contacting sales for custom quotes. Reports suggest Growth plans start around $3,600/year, with costs scaling significantly at higher volumes.

items.question: What happened to Heap? Was it acquired?
items.answer: Yes. Contentsquare acquired Heap in September 2023. Heap is now part of Contentsquare's experience intelligence platform. This acquisition may affect Heap's product direction, pricing, and independence.

items.question: Does OpenPanel have retroactive analysis like Heap?
items.answer: No. Heap's autocapture enables retroactive analysis. OpenPanel only analyzes events that were explicitly tracked. This is a trade-off: Heap offers flexibility but with data bloat; OpenPanel offers control but requires upfront planning.

items.question: Does OpenPanel have session replay?
items.answer: No. Heap offers session replay as an add-on on Pro and Premier plans. OpenPanel focuses on product analytics without session replay or heatmaps.
